title.bibl: Revyen, Dec. 22, 1906. [Danish Brotherhood to Celebrate Twenty-Fifth Anniversary]

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

div.bibl: Revyen, Dec. 22, 1906. [DANISH BROTHERHOOD TO CELEBRATE TWENTY-FIFTH ANNIVERSARY]

body.p: The Danish Brotherhood of America will celebrate its twenty-fifth anniversary soon. All Danish Brotherhood lodges in Chicago will celebrate on New Year's Day with a big banquet at the 2nd Regiment Armory.
About eight hundred dinner guests are expected. The Supreme President, Mr. Vogt, of Davenport, Iowa, will be present.
A prologue has been written by Blickenberg-Jensen. The official speakers will be Martin Andersen, A. M. Petersen, and Carl Hansen.
A special ninety-six-page program has been printed, which contains many advertisements and a little about the history of the Danish Brotherhood in Chicago.
